name: Frequency Tweaks
desc:
An old miners’ trick, this simple modification dials down the frequency of the beams or bolts produced via adjustments to local flux grids and power outputs.

Increases range of energy weapons by %s.
Decreases energy weapon damage by %s.

Bonus is %s for hybrid weapons.
short: Increases hybrid and energy weapon range, but decreases damage.

name: Converted Missile Bay
desc:
The cargo bay of this ship has been overhauled into an impromptu missile bay, increasing ordnance capacity significantly.
Increases ammo capacity of missile weapons by %s. Reduces cargo capacity by %s.

Due to improper containment protocols, stored ordnance may “cook off” if jostled too much.
Ship explosion damage and radius is %s.

Incompatible with Expanded Missile Racks and Missile Autoloader.
short: Increases missile weapon ammo, greatly decreases cargo capacity and increases explosion radius..

name: Sparse Hangar
desc:
The flight deck of this ship carries only the bare necessities to operate a wing of fighters, and takes a while to replenish any combat losses.
It can be adjusted to fly more offensive fightercraft with great difficulty, due to the many compromises involved when interfacing incompatible hardware.

Reduces cargo capacity by %s.
Fighter replacement time is increased by %s.
short: Reduces cargo capacity and increases fighter replacement time.

name: Overstressed Phase Coils
desc:
Whether through insufficient support, corrosion of delicate components, or reckless redlining, the phase coils of this vessel can only manage a brief dive of about a few seconds before being forcefully ejected from P-Space - or worse.

The coils cannot handle high levels of hard flux, decreasing the threshold at which speed bottoms out by %s. For standard-design coils with no other modifications, this takes the threshold from %s to %s. In addition, calibrating the coils properly is all but impossible - peak performance time is decreased by %s, and combat readiness degradation is increased by %s.

However, the phase-time bonus has increased %s - perhaps due to the way the coils have been butchered.

This hullmod is considered a %s, but it %s.
short: Increases phase-time bonus, at the cost of staying power.
